problem: Solve the inequality $|3x - 6| \leq 9$. Provide the range of $x$ that satisfies this condition in the form of intervals.
solution: The absolute value condition $|3x - 6| \leq 9$ implies two inequalities: $3x - 6 \leq 9$ and $3x - 6 \geq -9$. Solving these separately, we get $3x \leq 15$ and $3x \geq -3$. Dividing all parts by 3, we get $x \leq 5$ and $x \geq -1$. Thus, the solution is $\boxed{[-1, 5]}$.
